# viewDidHide()

**Instance Method**

Invoked when the view is hidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being hidden.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func viewDidHide()
```

## Discussion

The view receives this message when its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/isHiddenOrHasHiddenAncestor] property changes from [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. This happens when the view or an ancestor is marked as hidden, or when the view or an ancestor is inserted into a new view hierarchy.

## Showing and Hiding the View

- **isHidden**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden.
- **isHiddenOrHasHiddenAncestor**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden from sight because it, or one of its ancestors, is marked as hidden.
- **viewDidUnhide()**: Invoked when the view is unhidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being unhidden
